item.quote: An Elegant and more thoughtfully designed function is compact and cryptic

Each pattern describes a problem which occurs over and over again in our environment, and then describes the core of the solution to that problem, in such a way that you can use this solution a million times over, without ever doing it the same way twice.
Optimism is an occupational hazard of programming: feedback is the treament.

More than the act of testing, the act of designing tests is one of the best bug preventers known. The thinking that must be done to create a useful test can discover and eliminate bugs before they are coded - indeed, test-design thinking can discover and eliminate bugs at every stage in the creation of software, from conception to specification, to design, coding and the rest.
If you can't test it, don't build it. If you don't test it, rip it out.
If you make a general statement, a programmer says, 'Yes, but...' while a designer says, 'Yes, and...'
Walking on water and developing software from a specification are easy if both are frozen.
Introducing test automation is sometimes like a romance: Stormy, emotional, resulting in either a spectacular flop or a spectacular success.
A programming language is a tool that has a profound influence on our thinking habits.
Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
When I am working on a problem, I never think about beauty. I think only of how to solve the problem. But when I have finished, if the solution is not beautiful, I know it is wrong.
